metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11006 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
In GraphicsMagick 1.4 snapshot-20190322 Q8, there is a heap-based bufferover-read in the function ReadMIFFImage of coders/miff.c, which allowsattackers to cause a denial of service or information disclosure via an RLEpacket.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11006` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphicsmagick++3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
libgraphicsmagick3 - 1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.18-1ubuntu3.1+esm8').
